newsitem.title: USA: OncorMed says patent received for gene ideas.
newsitem.headline: OncorMed says patent received for gene ideas.

text.p: OncorMed Inc said Thursday the Regents of the University of California have received a patent for discoveries related to the BRCA1 gene associated with breast, ovarian and prostrate cancer.
The company said the University of California patent, for which it holds a license, is the first to have issued on BRCA1 genetic markers.
The company said five to 10 percent of breast cancer is inherited, with mutations in the BRCA1 gene accounting for about 45 percent of these cases and BRCA2 mutations accounting for about 35 percent.

The company said woman who have BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations have an 85 percent chance of developing breast cancer in their lifetime and a greatly increased risk of developing ovarian cancer (40-60 percent for BRCA1 and 15-20 percent for BRCA2.)
The company said men with a BRCA1 mutation have an about eight percent risk up to the age of 70 of developing prostrate cancer.
OncorMed said it provides genetic testing to identify mutations in borth the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes.
The company said the patent was issued April 22.
